w5300.c File Reference

Detailed Description

Implementation of W5300 I/O fucntions

This file implements the basic I/O fucntions that access a register of W5300(IINCHIP_REG).

Revision History :
Date Version Author Description
24/03/2008 1.0.0 MidnightCow Release with W5300 launching
01/05/2008 1.0.1 MidnightCow Refer to M_01052008.
Modify a logical error in iinchip_irq().
15/05/2008 1.1.0 MidnightCow Refer to M_15052008.
Delete getSn_DPORTR() because Sn_DPORTR is write-only.
Replace 'Sn_DHAR2' with 'Sn_DIPR2' in getSn_DIPR().
08/08/2008 1.2.0 MidnightCow & Gorulko Dmitry Refer to M_08082008.
Add IINCHIP_CRITICAL_SECTION_ENTER() & IINCHIP_CRITICAL_SECTION_EXIT() to wiz_read_buf() and wiz_write_buf().

Definition in file w5300.c.

#include "w5300.h"
#include "lstring.h"
#include "md5.h"

Go to the source code of this file.

uint16 getPSIDR ( void   ) 

It gets PSIDR value.

Returns:
The value of PSIDR.
Note:
PSIDR is read-only register.
However, in order to set PPP session ID(PSIDR), You can do it by writing S0_DPORTR to PPP session ID.

Definition at line 464 of file w5300.c.

References IINCHIP_READ(), and Sn_RX_FIFOR.

uint32 getSn_RX_RSR ( SOCKET  s  ) 

It gets Sn_RX_RSR value.

Parameters:
[in] s SOCKET number. It is valid when 0 <= s <= MAX_SOCK_NUM - 1.
Returns:
It returns the byte size of received data in internal RX memory of s-th SOCKET.
Warning:
Warning:
The host can read the wrong value of Sn_RX_RSR.
Because Sn_TX_RSR is not changed by 'system bus signal' but changed by synchronous 'NIC_CLK' clock.
To prevented this problem, the host should read it until the previous value is equal to the curruent.

Definition at line 444 of file w5300.c.

References IINCHIP_READ(), and Sn_RX_RSR.

Referenced by loopback_tcpc(), loopback_tcps(), loopback_udp(), pppinit_in(), and recv().

uint32 getSn_TX_FSR ( SOCKET  s  ) 

It gets Sn_TX_FSR value.

Parameters:
[in] s SOCKET number. It is valid when 0 <= s <= MAX_SOCK_NUM - 1.
Returns:
It returns the free size of internal TX memory(the byte size of transmittable data) of s-th SOCKET.
Warning:
Warning:
The host can read the wrong value of Sn_TX_FSR.
Because Sn_TX_FSR is not changed by 'system bus signal' but changed by synchronous 'NIC_CLK' clock.
To prevented this problem, the host should read it until the previous value is equal to the curruent.

Definition at line 430 of file w5300.c.

References IINCHIP_READ(), and Sn_TX_FSR.

Referenced by close(), and send().

void getUIPR ( uint8 *  addr  ) 

It gets the unreachable destination IP address of ICMP message.

Parameters:
[out] addr Storage location for input the unreachable destination IP address. It should be allocated 4bytes size.
Note:
PDHAR is read-only register.
However, in order to set PPPoE server hardware address(PDHAR), You can do it by writing S0_DHAR to PPPoe server hardware address.
See also:
getUPORTR(), IR_DPUR

Definition at line 232 of file w5300.c.

References IINCHIP_READ(), and UIPR.

Returns:
The unreachable destination port number
See also:
getUIPR(), IR_DPUR

Definition at line 240 of file w5300.c.

References IINCHIP_READ(), and UPORTR.

void iinchip_init ( void   ) 

It initializes W5300.

It initializes W5300 by soft reset and decides the host interface mode by configuration MR.

Note:
You can modify this function to configure MR_WDF, MR_RDH, MR_FS, MR_DBS, MR_PB, MR_PPPoE.

Definition at line 518 of file w5300.c.

References MR, MR_IND, MR_RST, and wait_10ms().

Referenced by Main().

void iinchip_irq ( void   ) 

It handles the interrupt of W5300.

Todo:
You should do implement your interrupt request routine instead of this function. If you want to use ISR, this function should be mapped in your ISR handler.

Definition at line 536 of file w5300.c.

References IINCHIP_CRITICAL_SECTION_ENTER, IINCHIP_CRITICAL_SECTION_EXIT, IINCHIP_READ(), IINCHIP_WRITE(), IR, IR_DPUR, IR_IPCF, IR_SnINT, MAX_SOCK_NUM, Sn_IR, SOCK_INT, UIPR, and UPORTR.

uint16 IINCHIP_READ ( uint32  addr  ) 

Basic I/O function.

It reads a value from a register

Parameters:
[in] addr register address
Returns:
the value of register
Note:
If you define __DEF_IINCHIP_DIRECT_MODE__, you can use the below code instead of this function for the better performance. 
 #define IINCHIP_READ(uint32 addr) (*(vint16*)addr)

References IDM_AR, IDM_DR, IINCHIP_CRITICAL_SECTION_ENTER, and IINCHIP_CRITICAL_SECTION_EXIT.

void IINCHIP_WRITE ( uint32  addr,
uint16  data 
)

Basic I/O function.

It writes a value to a register

Parameters:
[in] addr register address
[in] data write data
Returns:
void
Note:
If you define __DEF_IINCHIP_DIRECT_MODE__, you can use the below code instead of this function for the better performance. 
 #define IINCHIP_WRITE(uint32 addr,uint16 data)  ((*(vint16*)addr) = data)

uint8 pppinit ( uint8 *  id,
uint8  idlen,
uint8 *  passwd,
uint8  passwdlen 
)

It initializes to PPPoE of W5300.

It initiazes W5300 for PPPoE and calls pppinit_in() for PPPoE processing phase.
For the detail, refer to "How to use PPPoE in W5300".

Parameters:
[in] id User ID for connecting to a PPPoE server
[in] idlen Length of id
[in] passwd User password for connecting to a PPPoE server
[in] passwdlen Length of passwd
Returns:
It returns the result of pppinit_in()

Definition at line 1116 of file w5300.c.

References getMR(), getSn_IR(), MR_FS, MR_PPPoE, pppinit_in(), setMR(), setPMAGICR(), setPTIMER(), setSn_CR(), setSn_IR(), setSn_MR(), Sn_CR_CLOSE, Sn_CR_OPEN, and Sn_MR_PPPoE.

Referenced by Main().

uint8 pppinit_in ( uint8 *  id,
uint8  idlen,
uint8 *  passwd,
uint8  passwdlen 
)

Internal function.

It is called in pppinit().
It processes 4 phases as following.

  • PPPoE Discovery
  • LCP process
  • PPPoE authentication
  • IPCP process

Parameters:
id User ID for connecting to a PPPoE server
idlen Length of id
passwd User password for connecting to a PPPoE server
passwdlen Length of passwd
Returns:
1 - success
2 - ID or password error
3 - Timeout occurs while processing PPPoE
4 - Not support authentication type.

Definition at line 821 of file w5300.c.

References getPATR(), getSn_IR(), getSn_RX_RSR(), PPP_OPTION_BUF_LEN, setSn_CR(), setSn_IR(), setSn_TX_WRSR(), Sn_CR_PCJ, Sn_CR_PCON, Sn_CR_PCR, Sn_CR_RECV, Sn_IR_PFAIL, Sn_IR_PNEXT, Sn_IR_PRECV, wait_10ms(), wiz_read_buf(), and wiz_write_buf().

Referenced by pppinit().

void setSn_KPALVTR ( SOCKET  s,
uint8  time 
)

It sets Sn_KPALVTR value.

Parameters:
[in] s SOCKET number. It is valid when 0 <= s <= MAX_SOCK_NUM - 1.
[in] time The keep alive timer value of s-th SOCKET to be set. The unit is 5 seconds.
Note:
When Sn_KPALVTR > 0, KEEP ALIVE(KA) packet is automatically transmitted and Sn_CR_SEND_KEEP is ignored.
When Sn_KPALVTR = 0, KA packet is manually transmitted by Sn_CR_SEND_KEEP.
See also:
getSn_KPALVTR()

uint8 sysinit ( uint8 *  tx_size,
uint8 *  rx_size 
)

It allocate internal TX/RX memory of each SOCKET.

Parameters:
[in] tx_size The pointer to allocate tx_size[n] to the internal TX memory of each SOCKET.
( 0 <= n <= MAX_SOCK_NUM-1).
TX memory size of each SOCKET is configurable in the range of 0~64Kbytes. Total memory size of each SOCKET's TX memory should be the multiple of 8.
[in] rx_size The pointer to allocate rx_size[n] to the internal RX memory of each SOCKET.
( 0 <= n <= MAX_SOCK_NUM-1).
RX memory size of each SOCKET is configurable in the range of 0~64Kbytes. Total memory size of each SOCKET's TX memory and RX memory should be 128Kbytes.
Returns:
If success, it returns 1. Otherwize 0.

Definition at line 577 of file w5300.c.

References IINCHIP_READ(), IINCHIP_WRITE(), MAX_SOCK_NUM, MTYPER, RMS01R, RMS23R, RMS45R, RMS67R, RXMEM_SIZE, TMS01R, TMS23R, TMS45R, TMS67R, and TXMEM_SIZE.

Referenced by Main().

uint32 wiz_read_buf ( SOCKET  s,
uint8 *  buf,
uint32  len 
)

It copies data to your buffer from internal RX memory.

It copies the len bytes of internal RX memory of s-th SOCKET to buf through Sn_RX_FIFOR.

Parameters:
[in] s SOCKET number. It is valid when 0 <= s <= MAX_SOCK_NUM - 1.
[out] buf Destination buffer to copy
The length of buf should be equal or greater than len + 1, in order to prevent the memory violation.
[in] len bytes of internal RX memory of s-th SOCKET to copy.
Returns:
The copied byte number
Note:
In case using interrupt or multi-task, it is protected with IINCHIP_CRITICAL_SECTION_ENTER() & IINCHIP_CRITICAL_SECTION_EXIT() while Sn_RX_FIFOR read.
If no use, it can be occured some problem such as invalid PACKET_INFO or DATA.

Definition at line 714 of file w5300.c.

References IDM_AR, IDM_DR, IINCHIP_CRITICAL_SECTION_ENTER, IINCHIP_CRITICAL_SECTION_EXIT, IINCHIP_READ(), and Sn_RX_FIFOR.

Referenced by pppinit_in(), recv(), and recvfrom().

uint32 wiz_write_buf ( SOCKET  s,
uint8 *  buf,
uint32  len 
)

It copies data to interna1 TX memory.

It copies the len bytes of buf to internal TX memory of s-th SOCKET through Sn_TX_FIFOR.

Parameters:
[in] s SOCKET number. It is valid when 0 <= s <= MAX_SOCK_NUM - 1.
[in] buf Source buffer to copy from
[in] len bytes of data to copy.
Returns:
The copied byte number
Note:
In case using interrupt or multi-task, it is protected with IINCHIP_CRITICAL_SECTION_ENTER() & IINCHIP_CRITICAL_SECTION_EXIT() while Sn_TX_FIFOR write.
If no use, it can be occured some problem such that invalid DATA are transmitted.
